channel.title: [PHP] Date Function
channel.description: [center][size=12pt][b]Format Codes for Use with date()[/b][/size][/center] [center]______________________________________________________________ /* Format Description Example a 'am' or 'pm' lowercase pm A 'AM' or 'PM' uppercase PM d Day of month (number with leading zeroes) 20 D Day of week (three letters) Thu F Month name January h Hour (12-hour format) 12 H Hour (24-hour format) 12 g Hour (12-hour format without leading 0) 12 G Hour (24-hour format without leading 0) 12 i Minutes 47 j Day of the month (no leading zeroes) 20 1 Day of the week (name) Thursday L Leap year ('1' for yes, '0' for no) 1 m Month of year (number) 01 M Month of year (three letters) Jan n Month of year (number without leading 0) 1 s Seconds of hour 24 U Time stamp 948372444 y Year (two digits) 00 Y Year (four digits) 2000 z Day of year (0?65) 19 Z Offset in seconds from GMT 0 */ ______________________________________________________________ [/center] [center][size=12pt][b]Formatting a Date with date()[/b][/size][/center] [code=php] Formatting a date with date() ", time()); print "Today is "; print date("j of F Y, \a\\t g.i a", time()); ?> [/code] [center][b]I TAKE NO CREDIT! THIS IS JUST AN EXAMPLE FROM: [url=http://www.java2s.com/]Java2S[/url][/b][/center]

item.title: [PHP] Date Function
item.dc:creator: @Cheese_Police c|p
item.description:
@Cheese_Police wrote:

This is a pretty pointless thread, although I applaud your efforts (well, not really).

http://us.php.net/manual/en/function.date.php is much more informative anyway, and includes plenty of examples.

Read full topic

item.title: [PHP] Date Function
item.dc:creator: @Toxic95 Toxic95
item.description:
@Toxic95 wrote:

[quote=".Unlimited, post:14, topic:416610"][quote author=Toxic95 link=topic=518500.msg3768692#msg3768692 date=1317489345]

Did you actually look at what you posted?

[quote]<?php
print date(“m/d/y G.i:s
”, time());
print "T><?php
print date(“m/d/y G.i:s
”, time());
print "Today is ";
print date(“j of F Y, \a\t g.i a”, time());
?>[/quote]

I don’t know much about PHP, so I assume it’s correct.
[/quote]
So you posted a “tutorial” on something you don’t know?[/quote]

Basicaly. I just trying to show an example from a site I found, it’s very quite helpful. It has: C++; Java Book; C#; SQL Server; Those are just some I named off the top of my head.

Read full topic

item.title: [PHP] Date Function
item.dc:creator: @Toxic95 Toxic95
item.description:
@Toxic95 wrote:

[center][size=12pt]Format Codes for Use with date()[/size][/center]

[center]______________________________________________________________

/*

Format Description Example

a ‘am’ or ‘pm’ lowercase pm

A ‘AM’ or ‘PM’ uppercase PM

d Day of month (number with leading zeroes) 20

D Day of week (three letters) Thu

F Month name January

h Hour (12-hour format) 12

H Hour (24-hour format) 12

g Hour (12-hour format without leading 0) 12

G Hour (24-hour format without leading 0) 12

i Minutes 47

j Day of the month (no leading zeroes) 20

1 Day of the week (name) Thursday

L Leap year (‘1’ for yes, ‘0’ for no) 1

m Month of year (number) 01

M Month of year (three letters) Jan

n Month of year (number without leading 0) 1

s Seconds of hour 24

U Time stamp 948372444

y Year (two digits) 00

Y Year (four digits) 2000

z Day of year (0?65) 19

Z Offset in seconds from GMT 0
*/

[/center]

[center][size=12pt]Formatting a Date with date()[/size][/center]

<html>
<head>
<title>Formatting a date with date()</title>
</head>
<body>
<?php
print date("m/d/y G.i:s<br>", time());
print "Today is ";
print date("j of F Y, \a\\t g.i a", time());
?>
 </body>
</html>

[center]I TAKE NO CREDIT! THIS IS JUST AN EXAMPLE FROM: Java2S[/center]

Read full topic
